intro: Chassalia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, narrow leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Chassalia microphylla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
